page.title: 13AMPFIELD WOOD
page.content: { The bridleways}throughout the {forest}are not only used for horse riding but also serve a purpose in case of forest fires .the tracks are bulldozed then covered with gravel and so help in preventing forest fires .The only rights the landowners have now are the sporting rights ,but no pheasant shooting is allowed.Hunts go through the woods ,but the Forestry Commission have trouble with the hoofprints. The wood is sold standing from Â£2.00 cubic metre to Â£40.00 cubic metre,but the average they sell it for is Â£7.00 cubic metre .Altogether the forest is 1104 acres Part of it belongs to St.Martins Property Investments L.T.D and the other part belongs to the{Braishfield Estate. }
